creator.name: dpalou
description:
In Android N, Google introduced the Multi-Window feature for apps (you can see 2 apps at the same time). This is something that Samsung devices already allowed.

We should check if we can and we want to support this in the app.

Supporting Android's Multi-Window should be as easy as modifying the manifest. We need to be careful with this though:
{quote}Note: If you build a multi-orientation app that targets API level 23 or lower, and the user uses the app in multi-window mode, the system forcibly resizes the app. The system presents a dialog box warning the user that the app may behave unexpectedly. The system does not resize fixed-orientation apps; if the user attempts to open a fixed-orientation app under multi-window mode, the app takes over the whole screen.
{quote}
More details:

https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/multi-window.html
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Support Android Multi-Window

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
How to reproduce:
 # In Moodle, create an activity that uses the check updates WS.
 # In the app, download the activity.
 # In Moodle, modify something in the activity so the app detects it has something new.
 # In the app, perform a PTR. The activity should be marked as outdated.
 # Download the activity again.
 # Go offline and perform a PTR. The activity will be marked as outdated again, but it shouldn't.

The reason is that in the step 6 the check updates WS call fails, so it gets the result from cache and it detects the old changes.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Activities are marked as outdated when it shouldn't when using the check updates WS

creator.name: jorisgoflex
description:
The video player of Vimeo, Youtube and at least one other player behave differently in the hybrid app on Android, compared to the mobile browser (tested Chrome). The full screen button is hidden in the hybrid app, while it is not on the mobile browser. 

So somehow the hybrid app is causing this behavior. Someone else tested this as well, appearantly the full screen button is present on Android tablets, it's just not working (don't have a tablet to test this).

[https://vimeo.com/forums/help/topic:286569]

 

Interestingly, the creative captions button can be made visible (see screenshot)

[http://imgur.com/a/Pho46]

 

EDIT: I did some more testing. On a different authoring tool (Storyline 360), I added a Youtube video as web component. Again, the full screen button is not there. ([http://imgur.com/a/DqQeP|http://imgur.com/a/DqQeP] )

*However*

creator.name: francois.bruneau
description:
Testing instructions:
 # Install the app on an iOS phone (tested on iPhone SE / iOS 10.2.1)
 # Enter the Moodle URL on first screen
 # Click on "Connect"
 # On login screen, the virtual keyboard (that has been displayed automatically) covers the username field, while it would be expected that the view scrolls down so that the user sees the username field (which has focus). 
 # When attempting to scroll manually, the view automatically goes back to top, rendering it impossible to get visual feedback when typing username, excepted by repeatedly scrolling down to check the entered characters.

Quick fix would be not to show the virtual keyboard automatically on the login screen. (but this would be un-doing of -MOBILE-1308-)

description:
We've had reports that the Moodle mobile app has been causing issues in submitting assignments. One of the problems that we have identified and I have submitted a separate ticket for is that the mobile app's inability to retrieve the Moodle assignment submission statement. Setting this feature to NO will fix this.

Another issue that I found is that if we use the Poodll filter for assignments in the way of submission or feedback, students are not able to submit their work via the app as an error indicates that the Poodll filter is not available on a mobile device. When the Poodll filter is deactivated in the assignment settings, submissions are possible and all works well for students.

Is there a way to get the Poodl plugin working on the mobile app? Thanks.

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now, when we perform a PTR in a resource (mod_resource, page, etc.) we invalidate ALL files, so they have to be downloaded again. Since the user is now able to delete the downloaded files, we shouldn't invalidate those that have a right revision/timemodified. 

The hard part is to invalidate only some of the files in the resource, since right now all of them have the same component+componentId.

Also, when a user clicks to synchronize a site we invalidate all the files in the site. Maybe we shouldn't do that.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Don't invalidate content files in PTR of resources

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: krause
description:
Hi Juan,

I created a new course in Moodle and saved a file resource. I took the "Raspberry Pi - Project Book v2" again. The file has 46 MB. [https://www.raspberrypi.org/magpi-issues/Projects_Book_v2.pdf]

I made a backup in Moodle which has 41.8 MB. I did this to see how Moodle will save the resource. Then I saved the same file again within a folder resource. I have two resources in my course. And I made a backup again ... 41.8 MB for both resources. Moodle uses a file management and does not save the same file twice.

In the mobile app I deleted all memory for the website. I logged in and needed 670 kB for this website in the app. I downloaded both resources into the mobile app ... it needed 45.9 MB for the first resource and 91.2 MB for both resources. The app downloaded and saved the same file more than only once.

This takes double time, double download data and double memory size in the app. Is there any way to change this fact? I do not know if the files are marked with a hash string or something else.

Ralf
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: krause
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: App downloads and saves the same file more than only once

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: krause
description:
Hi,

in my demo course I have some resources to show that they are usable offline. When my iPad is offline everything looks fine. There is a text page with an embedded locally saved film, a file resource with a big pdf document and a folder resource with some subfolders and files in it. All resources are shown very fast in offline mode.

I found that it takes very long time to open the files when the iPad is online. To open the pdf document "Raspberry Pi Projects Book v2" takes 4 minutes. [https://www.raspberrypi.org/magpi-issues/Projects_Book_v2.pdf] ... I took this book as an example because it's free and creative commons and someone can read it when he does not like my workshop. :)

The document has 204 pages, 46 MB, and it's save locally in the moodle website as you wrote in the documentation for "mobile friendly moodle courses". I think the file is reloaded from the moodle website again but the document was not changed on the website ... and that 's not a good idea.

In my school we have an internet connection with only 16 megabits/s for more than 1500 persons. Everybody must switch of his internet connection to get the preloaded resources from the mobile app. And he has to switch on the internet connection to look into online resources like a database or a feedback. This will not work!

Ralf
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: krause
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: locally saved resources are loaded again

When a video is embedded on the page (via VideoJS or iframe), you can't scroll "on" the video. This means that if there is one or multiple videos taking up the whole of your screen space, you can be left with nowhere to scroll.

To reproduce:
 * Embed a video (YouTube, or MP4) on a course page, using either/both VideoJS and embedded iframe

 * Scroll down the page with the video
 * Try to scroll on the embedded video

You should be able to scroll on the video, like you can on a website with an embedded video.

Actual:

creator.name: dpalou
description:
The FileTransfer download is throwing the error:

code:3
exception: Connection cosed by peer.

I looked for it and in some places it says that TLS 1.2 is supported but not enabled by default in Android 4.4 and older. The problem is that "enabling" it means changing the native code of FileTransfer, and it could cause problems with other certificates.

In other places it says that it depends on the vendor, some brands might have removed TLS 1.2 support at all so there would be no fix for those.

I also read that these params could fix it, but it didn't work for me, the only change is that the error was thrown later:
Connection: 'close'
chunkMode: false
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Android 4.4 and older can't download/upload files with TLS 1.2 certificates

The links on 
https://messages.moodle.net

are not behaving like usual links would.

Klicking on

* Register (https://messages.moodle.net/auth/login?next=%2F###)
* Stats (https://messages.moodle.net/stats/ and https://messages.moodle.net/auth/login?next=%2Fstats%2F)
* Server Info (https://messages.moodle.net/info/ and https://messages.moodle.net/auth/login?next=%2Finfo%2F)

just stays on the same site.

I wonder whether you could look into. And, yes, does https://messages.moodle.net ,as of today, really deliver push notifications for iOS, Android and Windows at all?

Best regards

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: dpalou
description:
In survey in tablet we use the default input radio buttons, since Ionic ion-radio is designed to show 1 item per row. These default buttons are small and hard to click.

Input radio doesn't support padding, so I was thinking that we should create a directive and apply it to the container div. When this div is clicked, the inner input radio should be clicked via JS.

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: pferre22
description:
If the user continued a feedback in the app:
* If in web the feedback is finished a no more submissions are allowed: error
* If in web the feedback is finished and more submissions are allowed: a new submission will be created
* If in web the feedback is not finished, questions values will be overridden only if the completion time of the app answers is bigger than the completion time of the web answers

If the user started a feedback in the app
* If in web the feedback is finished a no more submissions are allowed: error
* If in web there aren't feedbacks or a feedback finished and more submissions are allowed: a new submission will be created
* If in web the feedback is not finished, questions values will be overridden only if the completion time of the app answers is bigger than the completion time of the web answers
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: pferre22
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Check special sync cases on feedback

creator.name: krause
description:
I found that a mp4 video plays without any audio in Moodle Mobile 3.2 on my iPhone 6s. The iPhone runs with iOS 10.2.1. I tested the problem with a video in a folder resource and with the video html5 tag which is generated by the Atto Media tool.

The course and the same video resource does not have any problem on an iPad Air 2 and on an iPad Pro 9.7. I got also no problem on an old iPad 2 running iOS 9.3.5 and Moodle Mobile 3.2.

Best regards, Ralf

priority.name: Major
reporter.name: krause
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
We detected 2 ways to decrease them:

# Mark resources as downloadable by default. Right now we load the module contents and check if the resource has contents. If we always treat them as downloadable we can spare 1 request per module. This means that empty folders will be shown as downloadable.
# If the user performs a PTR and we have the WebService to check for updates, there's no need to invalidate some data to calculate the activity status. These invalidates sometimes call a WS to get required data.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Decrease network requests in section view

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
To build the list of recent discussions, we get the last 50 messages received and sent by the current user. This means that if a user has received a lot of messages in a discussion we might be showing a last message that isn't the right one in other discussions.

E.g. let's say that a user has talked with user A and user B. The conversation with user A is really short and finishes with a message from user A. Right after that starts the conversation with user B, where the current user barely sends message but it receives 50 messages from user B.

When we get the last 50 messages received, all of them are from user B so we get no messages from user A. But when we get the messages sent, we get the messages sent to user A since the current user barely sent messages. So the last message shown in discussion A is from the current user, and it should be from user A.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Last message in recent discussions isn't calculated right

description:
Right now we only display a certain amount of messages and there is no way to show older messages. We should allow the user to load older messages.

Also, right now we're always loading 50 messages sent from user A to user B and 50 messages sent from user B to user A. This doesn't guarantee that we're loading the 100 more recent messages. If we want to load X messages, we should get X messages sent from A to B and X messages sent from B to A, sort them and then get the X more recent messages.

creator.name: elaclare
description:
When tracker issue MOBILE-1709 was fixed it became possible to create MC questions using embedded audio (or links) as response options rather than text. However, I have noticed that these question load very slowly on the mobile app, especially when the question also contains an image file. Although the question load well via the browser (including mobile browsers), loading times of more than 20 seconds sometimes occur when using the app. To determine if this issue was caused by the size of the embedded audio files, I experimented with various file sizes ranging from 20KB to 200KB. I also experimented with a mix of audio and image files. In my testing, smaller audio files loaded slightly faster than larger ones. There was a much larger effect on loading time, however, when audio and image files were mixed in a single question. 

Steps to replicate the problem:
1) create a quiz 
2) add a multiple choice question containing an audio and image file in the Question text area and audio files in the Choice 1, Choice 2 and Choice 3 fields (note: the fields must be in HTML format)
3) start an attempt on the quiz using the Moodle Mobile app
4) observe the loading time of the question  

I expected that loading times using the mobile app would not differ significantly from those observed when using the browser, but in my experience this has not been the case.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: elaclare
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: MC questions containing mixed media (audio files and images) load very slowly on the app

creator.name: jhunt
description:
We have set up our site using Generico to deliver slightly different content to user depending on the device

i) Desktop: Video Player with interactive transcript / subtitles

ii) Mobile: Standard HTML5 video tags + subtitle/track

The videos are MP4 and the subtitles are web vtt (.vtt)

It works well, when the .vtt file is not embedded in the activity.  However when embedded, the subtitle file does not cache, or is not fetched or something. In this situation whether the user is offline  or online, the subtitle track doesn't show. If the subtitle file is not embedded in the activity it loads and displays correctly.

You can see embedded video + subtitles here (the problem situation)
https://demo.poodll.com/mod/page/view.php?id=201 (50mb video)
https://demo.poodll.com/mod/page/view.php?id=200 (15mb video)

You can see non-embedded video + subtitle versions of the same activities here
https://demo.poodll.com/mod/page/view.php?id=203 (50mb video)
https://demo.poodll.com/mod/page/view.php?id=202 (15 mb video)

To reproduce the problem you will need to a video + subtitle file. You can download them from the above activities if not handy. The HTML5 video tags would look like this:
<video controls preload="auto" width="320" height="240">
<source src="https://demo.poodll.com/somevideos/zombie_problems.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
<track label="subtitles" kind="subtitles" srclang="ja" src="https://demo.poodll.com/somevideos/zombie_problems.vtt" default>
</video>
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jhunt
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Embedded subtitle files don't work

It appears remote addons can't use directives without triggering security issues.

Packaging up a module that works when not an addon appears to have issues when packaged.

Error: [$sce:insecurl] Blocked loading resource from url not allowed by $sceDelegate policy.  URL: filesystem:http://localhost:8100/persistent/sites/05af9b4d326c0f5d15bcfd9a026aee74/filepool/remoteaddons/mod_hsuforum_mod_hsuforum/templates/discussionpost.html

That url is automatically transformed from ''addons/mod/hsuforum/templates/discussionpost.html' as part of the process of creating the remote addon. And the security settings don't seem to like it.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: bawjaws

summary: remote addons using directives throw security warnings

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: martinmine
description:
Currently there is no clear separation between which packages are under dependencies and devDependencies (see [this|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18875674/whats-the-difference-between-dependencies-devdependencies-and-peerdependencies] for a discussion regarding their difference). 
According to my understanding, only the front-end libraries that the front-end client (ionic-bower, and other bower components) goes under the dependencies tag, while all the existing once should be placed under devDependencies. 

All packages should be placed under devDependencies. When [#MOBILE-1830] is solved, bower packages should be placed under dependencies.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: martinmine
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Separation of devDependencies and dependencies in package.json

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: martinmine
description:
With the documentation on setting up the development environment, ionic-cli is installed by running `npm install -g ionic`. This will install the latest ionic-cli (currently v2). Once running `ionic serve`, it will not execute the gulp tasks specified in ionic.project and it is required to run `gulp watch` as a separate process manually.

Consider properly supporting ionic-cli v2, or specify in the documentation that ionic-cli v1 should be used.

priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: martinmine
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Gulp tasks not running with Ionic-cli v2 on ionic serve

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: martinmine
description:
NPM allows encapsulating commands through the scripts element in project.json. Currently, developers have to execute many commands in a specific sequence in order to set up and start the project.

By for example typing `npm setup` would run npm install, ionic state restore, bower, etc. in order to pull down the required dependencies and set up the dev environment. This issue involves enabling the following commands through NPM:
- npm start: Starts hosting the application through ionic serve and starts the gulp watch task
- npm setup: Sets up the development environment and pulls down the dev dependencies
- npm reinstall: Cleans node_modules, bower packages, platform directory and runs npm setup
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: martinmine
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Encapsulate commands for setting up and starting dev environment in NPM

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: Chamaco27
description:
Once a student completes all questions in a quiz, they are left guessing what to do next as there is no clear instruction or 'submit' icon that can be identified. The tiny blue arrow is the last thought for someone looking desperately to complete their work. Only after clicking on this tiny blue arrow found at the top of the screen, can a user then progress to review and submit. Why not improve this activity and add a 'review and/or submit' button at the bottom of the attempt? I'm thinking of the different users and some with disabilities. It will take out the guess work for them. This is one feature that I would love to see changed. 

Overall, I love the progress on the mobile app. Thank you kindly.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: Chamaco27
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Submit button for quiz activity would be a great benefit

description:
I am trying to setup the Mobile Dev env.

There is an issue with the appium-windows-driver and quick fix for that is restricting the version by "^1.4.0 <1.6.0". 

Now there is an issue with gulp build. It is being terminated midway with error.

Gulp build log is attached below.


{code:java}
[10:18:40] Starting 'build'...
[10:18:40] Starting 'sass-build'...
[10:18:40] Starting 'lang'...
[10:18:45] Finished 'sass-build' after 4.72 s

stream.js:94

            ^
Error: file to import not found or unreadable: www/lib/ionic/scss/ionic

{code}

*Steps to Reproduce* : 
* Start the Setup the Moodle Mobile Dev env from [here|https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Setting_up_your_development_environment_for_Moodle_Mobile_2]
* Fix the appium-windows-driver by modilfy the  appium version in package.json to "appium": "^1.4.11 <1.6.0"
* Proceed to gulp build process.

*What I expected* : Smooth setting up of the environment

*What actually happened* : Facing quite a bit of issues, this being the third one .



Whats mysterical is, I had already setup the entire env without any errors 24 hrs ago, and its running well then. Now when I am starting server, ionic din't even serve. So, I started the setup from scratch and many issues are occurring now. First, the 'lib-sass' issue, next appium-windows-driver' issue, now gulp build.

creator.name: Gachapen
description:
To reproduce: Do "npm install" from a clean clone of the master branch.

It does work with 1.5.3, but not with 1.6.0, so a breaking change must have happened.

The issue has been reported in the appium repo: https://github.com/appium/appium/issues/6992
The appium readme states that node version 4 or greater is required, so the only solution seems to be locking the version to less than 1.6.0 or upgrading node.

MOBILE-1796 will solve this issue.

Otherwise, this patch will work around it:

{code}
From 6b832c761da36ecd33548c9b8e0bffc42a21230d Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Magnus Bjerke Vik <mbvett@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, 27 Oct 2016 17:01:37 +0200
Subject: [PATCH] Force appium version to be below 1.6 to fix npm install issue

---
 package.json | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/package.json b/package.json
index 01890db..95a995e 100644
--- a/package.json
+++ b/package.json
@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@
     "gulp-rename": "^1.2.0"
   },
   "devDependencies": {
-    "appium": "^1.4.11",
+    "appium": "^1.4.11 <1.6.0",
     "bower": "^1.3.3",
     "gulp-clip-empty-files": "^0.1.1",
     "gulp-concat-util": "^0.5.2",
-- 
2.7.4


{code}

creator.name: martinmine
description: NPM already does much of what Bower does, and many people chose to migrate away from Bower in favor for NPM (see https://gofore.com/stop-using-bower/ ). This results in one fewer dependency in the project and simplifies maintenance and building the project. For Moodle, this requires to move the dependencies from node_modules to www/lib, for example as part of the gulp build task.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: martinmine
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Replace Bower with NPM

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Once MDL-54857 lands, will be able to improve the way we check a new site that wants to be added.

Instead doing the initial check against login/token, we can check via AJAX the response of  tool_mobile_get_public_config, from there we'll be able to retrieve the correct site settings, like the URL and get others important public settings (like the SSO support). This will allow us to:
* Detect if mobile services are enabled or not
* Detect if the sites is using SSO or not
* Add the site full name in the credentials screen
* Handle site maintenance status
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Blocker
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: The app new sites checking process should use tool_mobile_get_public_config when available

description:
Since I upgraded our moodle to 3.1.1, any user logging in to Moodle Mobile (version 3.1.2) gets error 'Cannot find data record in database table course'.

I suspect this may be related to the fact that our siteid is not 1.  I tested this with a new install.  As installed, ( id of the site course = 1, category =0)  and one other test course set up (id=2,category=1),everything was fine.  When I swapped the category of course id 2 to 0, and the category of course id 1 to 1, I got the error.

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Enabling file sharing with iTunes we'll allow people to load files in the /Documents folder of the Mobile app.

Enabling file sharing is easy, we just need to add this in the Phonegap build config.xml:

<gap:config-file platform="ios" parent="UIFileSharingEnabled" mode="replace">
<true/>
</gap:config-file>

But, we'll have to move or show this files in the Shared files option. (Show is the best choice here because they belong to any site)
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor

creator.name: jhicks
description:
Random users are unable to login using the Moodle Mobile App. Instead, they are presented with the following error message:
"Invalid response value detected"

Steps to Replicate:
1. Connect to the moodle mobile app 
2. Enter test username and password 
3. Try a different logging in as a different user until the below error message is received: "invalid response value detected."

Replicated on 3.1.1

Additional Investigation Notes:
The below forum mentions User Quota being an issue. Checked client's user quota to see if non-numerical values were in the Site Policies > User Quota area, and there were not:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=320873

Moodle mobile FAQs also mentions user quota: https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/Moodle_Mobile_FAQ#I_get_the_error_.22Invalid_response_value_detected.22_when_accessing_the_site

22 Aug, 13:14 Test Login - System System Web service function called The web service function 'moodle_webservice_get_siteinfo' has been called. ws 99.38.164.214 
22 Aug, 13:14 Test Login - System System Web service function called The web service function 'core_webservice_get_site_info' has been called. ws 99.38.164.214 
22 Aug, 13:14 Test Login - System System Web service token sent The user with id '199489' has been sent the web service token with id '21'. web 99.38.164.214

Client Impact: 3 - High impact for users affected since they are unable to use the Moodle Mobile App.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jhicks
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Random users are unable to login using the Moodle Mobile App

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: marckusdavis
description:
When attempting to log in to our Moodle site, which uses CAS authentication, via iOS v9.3.5, Moodle mobile gets all the way to where the user enters their CAS username and password, and then Safari returns an error message "Safari cannot open the page.  The error was: 'The URL can't be shown'".  The URL which Safari is trying to reach is: http://oursite.org/local/mobile/launch.php?service=local_mobile&passport=[passport number]&urlscheme=moodlemobile

I've even taken off the urlscheme to no avail.  The URL comes back as an error in Chrome on iOS too, "This site can't be reached".

This works fine on Android.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: marckusdavis
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: CAS SSO login not working on iOS

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: pferre22
description:
On some sites like moodlecloud when the volume of requests is higher than a value the server can request to try again after some time to avoid DoS.

When a 429 response status is detected we should:
# Check for "Retry-After" field on response header.
# Stop all requests until retry time passed.
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: pferre22
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Check response headers on error to retry if requested by the server.

creator.name: mytskine
description:
I could not find any documentation of the process that leads to a message being displayed on the mobile app. For instance, we sent a message from Moodle with the following text component (the "fullmessage" property):

{{The activity http://example.com/1/ etc.
etc etc.
http://example.com/2/}}

The HTML part of the message seems to be ignored. When the mobile app displays the message, the last URL of this text is converted to a link, but the former URL isn't. What are the rules?

See the [forum|https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=339121] for a few unanswered questions and reversed engineered suppositions.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: mytskine
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Document the messaging process

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description: Now the function __getFilePath_, called from __removeFileById_, relies on the extension stored in the filepool object. The problem is that we're removing the filepool entry at the same time we're calling __getFilePath_, creating a race condition. If the filepool object is removed fast, the delete of the physical file will fail.

priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Race condition in $mmFilepool#_removeFileById makes it fail

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now in some modules we aren't downloading description files (introfiles) and files embedded in content when we prefetch them, and we should do it.

Embedded files don't have a file size, the only way to calculate it is to perform a head request. We decided that, if we detect there are embedded files in description/content and we don't have WS data for them, we'll show the "cannot calculate" message. In the future we'll receive embedded files from the WS.

Also, in this issue we should check if invalidate files is really needed for the prefetched modules. Until now we used to invalidate all files when the user clicked refresh, but that can increase the network usage a lot for some activities.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Prefetch description files and embedded files - refactoring the existing prefetch

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now the function getFiles is called in several places, and that can affect the app's performance since that function can perform several WebService calls. We can decrease the usage with some changes:

# In _getModuleStatus_, we should only call _getFiles_ if it's really needed (_getRevision_ or _getTimemodified_ not implemented).
# In _getModuleDownloadedSize_ we could use a new handler function, _getDownloadedFiles_. If the handler uses component and componentId as it should, it should be able to retrieve the downloaded files without calling any WebService.
# In _removeModuleFiles_ we could use the same function as the previous point.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Decrease usage of getFiles in prefetch delegate

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now, when the user clicks to synchronize a site we only invalidate the downloaded data so it's redownloaded the next time he accesses the module.

As the name "synchonize" implies, we should also execute the synchronization processes only for that site. Since we are executing a partial synchronization (only one site), the last execution time shouldn't be affected so it's possible that the app executes the site sync and the "all sites" sync at the same time.

Some things to take into account:

* The documentation of the cron delegate already specifies that it can pass a siteId to the execute function. SCORM and quiz sync functions already support both options, all sites or single site, so they can be used as an example.
* We should show a spinner or something similar until all the processes are done. Right now we block the user using mmUtil#showLoading, we shouldn't do that.
* Should this skip the queue of cron processes?
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Execute sync hooks using cron delegate when the user clicks to sync a site

We need to check if we can also prefetch the required data to make auto-linking work too.

We should try to prefetch embedded files too, although the WebService doesn't return data about those files.

The main problem here is that we have no way to calculate the size of the download. The WebService already return the entries contents, and we don't have a WS to get the attached files. assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: elaclare
description:
In certain contexts it is common to use audio files instead of text as response options in a multiple choice question. Simply put, test-takers *hear * the choices rather than read them. At present the mobile app does not support the use of audio files as choices in MC quiz questions. When the test-taker attempts to play the audio file, a check appears indicating that an answer has been selected. The app is not able to distinguish an attempt to start the audio player from an attempt to select the choice as the correct answer. 

Steps to replicate the problem:
1) create a quiz 
2) add a multiple choice question containing audio files in Choice 1, Choice 2 and Choice 3 fields (note: the fields must be in HTML format)
3) start an attempt on the quiz using the Moodle Mobile app
4) attempt to play the files contained in the choices

I expected to be able to listen to the various response options for the question and then choose an answer. However, I was only able to select answers without being able to listen to the choices.

!https://moodlemagic.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/mcq.png!
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: elaclare
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Unable to click on links and buttons on "Choice" fields of a multiple choice question

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: wtdev
description:
Latest release of Moodle Mobile Phonegap project crashes straight after the splash screen. 

Once I removed the line: "gap:plugin name="com.phonegap.plugins.pushplugin" from Open config.xml the app builds correctly. 

The problem is this plugin controls Push Notifications, one of the biggest reasons we had for customising the app. 

Searching this plugin, I find that https://github.com/phonegap-build/PushPlugin is deprecated. Could this be updated to https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap-plugin-push to fix this issue ?

priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: wtdev
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Moodle Mobile Phonegap push notifications

description:
It may be based in this one:
https://github.com/sergiogomez/docker-moodle

But it will require some additional features:
- When launching the machine, a new parameter indicating the Moodle version and additional plugins to enable must be indicated (local_mobile, qaccessrule_offline)
- After Moodle and plugins are installed a course backup must be restored
- Mobile services must be enabled (and plugins configured when relevant)

Moodle and plugins matrix:
- Versions from 2.6 to latest with or without
- local_mobile and/or qaccessrule_offline

The machine should run Apache + PHP 5.6 + MySQL latest recommended by Moodle

assignee.name: pferre22

description:
Reported via e-mail.

A user could access and play a SCORM in his tablet, but if he tried in a Samsung Galaxy Trend Plus GT-S7580 he got the error "Error getting SCORM data".

After some debugging we found that the problem is in _$mmaModScormOffline#getAttempts_, when calling _db.whereEqual_. It seems that the problem is when calling _list()_ in _callWhereEqual_. The exception thrown is:

*TYPE_MISMATCH_ERR: DOM Exception 17*

Affected devices:

* Samsung Galaxy Trend Plus GT-S7580
* Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Lite SM-T110
* Samsung Galaxy S3 mini GT-I8190
* Samsung Note II
* Samsung Galaxy Grand Neo
* Samsung Galaxy Note Tablet GT-N8005 Android: 4.1.2
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: "Error getting SCORM data" when opening SCORM in online in some devices

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: rohitshriwas
description:
Moodle version: 3.1, Moodle Mobile version: 3.1.0

Greetings,

We've been trying to use the Moodle Mobile app with our SSO enabled Moodle installation. We needed to [enable authentication using SSO methods|https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features#Enable_authentication_for_sites_using_SSO_methods_.28like_Shibboleth_and_CAS.29] for it and now we correctly see the browser opening when we enter our site address in the app.

However, we noticed when we have HTTPS available (available, not enforced) on our server, the app never quite returns from the browser and we end up with the Moodle mobile site in the browser itself after SSO login is complete. Disabling HTTPS entirely fixes this behaviour, and we're correctly brought back to the app as soon as we've entered our SSO credentials in the browser.

We've tried this with and without enforcing login from Site Administration and we've always observed the exact same behaviour.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Install Moodle, along with the [Moodle Mobile additional features|https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features] plugin
# Add an SSL certificate to Apache configuration
# Install, configure and enable the Shibboleth NativeSP Apache module for SAML based SSO
# [Enable authentication for sites using SSO methods|https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features#Enable_authentication_for_sites_using_SSO_methods_.28like_Shibboleth_and_CAS.29]
# Install Moodle Mobile on Android
# Enter site hostname in the app, click connect
# At this point a browser opens and we're presented with the SSO login page
# Enter SSO credentials, the browser remains open, now with the Moodle mobile site on it

The following workaround fixes the issue for us:
# Disable HTTPS on Apache configuration OR
# Return 403 on the path /login/token.php using the following Apache directive: 
{code}
<Location /login/token.php>
        RewriteEngine On
        RewriteCond %{HTTPS} on
        RewriteRule (.*) http://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [F]
</Location>
{code}

I suspect it's an issue with the Referer header getting lost when we go from HTTPS->HTTP pages[^this code?^|https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/MOODLE_31_STABLE/login/index.php#L270], and consequently we end up on the /my/ path in the absence of a correct $SESSION->wantsurl.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: rohitshriwas
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Moodle Mobile, login not returning to app when using SSO authentication on an HTTPS site

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: albert.gasset
description:
The dialog with the message "Your authentication token is invalid or has expired, you have to reconnect to the site. You need to log in to the site in a browser window." is shown more than once when a token is expired. This happens when a fixed URL is set in config.json, and login is done via a browser window. This is similar to MOBILE-1425.

Steps to reproduce:

# Set the type of login to "Via a browser window" in the local plugin settings
# Build a custom app with a fixed URL in www/config.json (parameter "siteurl").
# Install and launch the app in a device.
# Log in with any user.
# Delete the token created for this user from the mdl_external_tokens table.
# Pull to refresh the list of courses.
# The dialog with text "Your authentication token is invalid or has expired [...]" is shown. Click "OK" and enter the username / password in the browser.

Result:
The same dialog is shown again. If you click "Cancel" you can continue to use the app as normal, already logged in. If you click "OK" the browser window is launched again.

This happens on Android, I have not tested other platforms.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: albert.gasset
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Users asked to login more than once when the token is expired

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
To detect the status of some modules we need to perform WS calls (SCORM, Quiz, Wiki, ...). If one of these modules is updated, performing a Pull To Refresh won't update the status because the WS data will be retrieved from cache, the only way is to wait for the cache to expire or do a Pull To Refresh in the module's entry page.

We should have an invalidate function in the prefetch delegate to invalidate this WS data. We should invalidate it when the user performs a Pull To Refresh in sections list or in a section. We should only invalidate the affected modules.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Invalidate prefetch WS calls when doing a pull-to-refresh in course contents

creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now embedded files are automatically downloaded if the files are small (<2MB in 3G, <20MB in WiFi) and when the user opens/plays them with WiFi connection. This means that the user might be downloading a lot of data without knowing it, and there's no way to track the progress of the download.

It would be nice to have a prefetch button for "big" files, like we do with some resources/activities. Also, I think the user should be able to delete already downloaded files (maybe even small files, and mark them somewhere so they aren't redownloaded again).
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Add prefetch buttons to embedded files

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: modguru
description:
Below is message that we received from Apple while trying to get it approved.

{quote}We noticed that the user needs to go to Safari to register for an account, which provides a poor user experience. 

Next Steps

Please revise your app to enable users to register an account in the app. 

We recommend implementing the Safari View Controller API to display web content within your app. The Safari View Controller allows the display of a URL and inspection of the certificate from an embedded browser in an app so that customers can verify the webpage URL and SSL certificate to confirm they are entering their sign in credentials into a legitimate page. 

Resources

For additional information on the Safari View Controller API, please see the webpage, What’s New in Safari.{quote}
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: modguru
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Enable users to sign up or register an account in the app

creator.name: pfranks
description:
1. Trying to login to Moodle site which has a 301 redirect from https:// to http:// produces the error message "A required parameter (username) was missing"

Following is displayed in Apache access log:
10.0.0.123 - - [09/May/2016:16:36:12 +0100] "POST /seg/login/token.php HTTP/1.1" 301 4312 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 9_2_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/601.1.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/13D15 (5181363472)"

10.0.0.123 - - [09/May/2016:16:36:12 +0100] "GET /seg/login/token.php HTTP/1.1" 200 529 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 9_2_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/601.1.46 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/13D15 (5181363472)"

It looks like there is a request from the app which gets redirected and then another request using get which doesn't appear to pass through any parameters.

I have tried accessing the URL to get a token using the browser:
https://MOODLE_URL_HERE/login/token.php?username=test&password=test&service=moodle_mobile_app

Even though their is a 301 redirect, the token is still retrieved ok.




It occurs on the iOS Moodle Mobile app Version: 3.0.0 and older and iOS OS version 9.2.1

priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: pfranks
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: A required parameter (username) was missing

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Right now if we open any resource, the resource is downloaded previously to be opened/played.

We should avoid that for large multimedia files like videos or audios, for large videos the user experience won't be ideal because he will have to wait for the full video to be downloaded.

I think that we can follow an approach based on connection and size (like we did in other areas):
- Wifi and small videos audios - Download the file and then open it
- Wifi and large video/audio - Streaming and download in the background (via filepool) the media
- 3g - Streaming always, the user must click to download the media
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Serve large multimedia content via streaming

assignee.name: albert.gasset
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Right now if a site is configured to force log in via the browser, the stock browser app is launched requesting the user credentials.

Instead launching the Inapp browser (embedded browser) we launch the stock browser to have a fully functional browser supporting javascript popups and other features.

We should add a new option in local_mobile "Via a embedded browser" to improve the user experience (the browser will be displayed embedded in the app).

This will require some changes:
- Add a new option in the local_mobile settings
- Support this new option in the app
- And, if the Inappbrowser is not able to "capture" the custom URL scheme, we should change how launch.php works to redirect a fake URL with the token as a parameter. See more information here: http://phonegap-tips.com/articles/google-api-oauth-with-phonegaps-inappbrowser.html
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Support to log in via SSO with an embedded browser

creator.name: jleyva
description:
There are some techniques for avoiding downloading files that haven't change, is well explained here:
https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/increasing-application-performance-with-http-cache-headers#conditional-requests
and
http://www.speedawarenessmonth.com/mobile-application-performance-caching/

We should evaluate to support both ETAGS and Last-Modified headers natively in the Filepool to reduce data consumption.

This should apply to remote CSS files and any file downloaded using the Filepool (or files from inline styles)
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Support HTTP Cache headers in the filepool

creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now we only update remote CSS files if:

* The file URL changes.
* The user clicks synchronize in App Settings.

It could be interesting to improve this, but we need to be careful with increasing the app's network usage.

An option would be to re-download them every certain time, but in most cases the CSS won't be modified once it's done so we might be re-downloading it a lot for nothing.

Another option would be to use a head request and detect file size (or etags if supported), but we don't want to perform too many head requests either.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Decide when to update remote CSS files

creator.name: birgit123
description:
I'd like to be able to prevent *+ALL +*downloading of audio and video files. I'm embedding the files from Moodle's repository folder using the link option. However, this does not prevent mobile devices to be given the option to download them!!!!

As a fix to this option to download media files, Juan Leyva suggested to create an ultimate URL to a file OUTSIDE of Moodle.
However, my Synoloy server protects all unauthorized access to files. This is wonderful and it should be like that. An ultimate URL to a non-public file is therefore also prevented.

Since Moodle accesses the repository folder excellently, I'd like to suggest that Moodle allows protection of files in that folder, so that I can choose whether files should be downloadable or not.

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
We should allow filtering participants. The problem is pagination (infinite loading).

We can do a single WS call to get all the users (without pages) and then iterate over them to get the ones we want. The problem is that if the user is offline he won't be able to use it even if the participants are cached per page. Also, there can be incoherencies between the results of seeing it using search and seeing it per page if a user changed its name or picture.

Another option is to retrieve the participants per page. I did a test and it's REALLY slow for courses with a lot of students. Let's say a WS call takes 5 seconds (in real cases can be more), it would take 50 seconds to load 500 students. 

Also, in courses with a lot of students it can be slow to iterate over all of them to find the ones we're looking for, maybe it would be better to find a WS to find them (like with Contacts, but searching only in the course).
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Allow searching participants

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
If a user is offline for a while in a chat, he's disconnected. We should try to automatically reconnect him to the chat room.

Also, when a user sends a message there's a delay until he's able  to see that message. We should try to avoid that like we do with messages.

Finally, if the polling of messages fails because the server is down or something like that, right now the user has to leave the room and enter it again to start the polling again. We should have a reconnect button.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Chat auto reconnect and improve delay with sending messages

assignee.name: pferre22
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Right now the filepool only looks for extensions in the URL of a file, so if a URL doesn't contain the file extension then it's going to download the file without it. This causes some problems.

If an SVG file is downloaded without extension then it's not going to work.

For example, in quiz we can download the icons:

{MOODLEURL}/theme/image.php/clean/core/1456928261/i/grade_correct
{MOODLEURL}/theme/image.php/clean/core/1456928261/i/grade_incorrect

Also, in iOS we can't open files without extension, they aren't shown. The new Moodle versions add the extension automatically to the files, but I guess old Moodles didn't do that so we've found several Moodles with this problem.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Improve the system to retrieve a file extension

Doesn't need to validate the URL as that stops intranet addresses from working.

Was fixed under the previous issue but seems to have reverted at some point.

I know the solution last time was to change to a simpler regex expression ^http(s)?\:\/\/.* but is any validation needed at all?

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
After a few seconds of playing a video, the controls disappear so the full video can be seen. In Android, when the controls disappear there's no way of getting them back. In iOS seems to be working fine.

[In this issue|https://forum.ionicframework.com/t/cant-play-html5-video-content-on-android/10096] this problem is discussed (amongst others). Using native scrolling (overflow-scroll=true) seems to fix it, but we discarded using it a while ago because it caused some problems (like PTR animation being slower). The also talk about using data-tap-disable="true", but that didn't work for me, and the iframe workaround is too hacky. 

EDIT: I noticed there was a typo in the data-tap-disable, it should be data-tap-disabled="true". With this it works fine.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: HTML5 video player controls cannot be retrieved when they disappear in Android

creator.name: dpalou
description:
While developing the quiz we took some decisions that should be discussed:

# Where should we place the navigation items? Right now we have arrows in the top and bottom of the quiz to go to next/previous page. We also have a TOC in a popover.
# Should we show a confirm modal before changing page in a sequential quiz? The user won't be able to go back to previous page.
# If an autosave fails, how much time should we wait before retrying? Right now we start the timer again, so it'll depend on the quiz autosave setting (1, 2 or 5 minutes). It's a big delay for a retry, but setting a lower delay might increase the server load.
# In review mode, if the user selects to see "one page at a time" right now we'll show the attempt summary at the start of each page. Maybe we should show it only when all the questions are shown at once, or move it to a top right button to see it, ...

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Steps to reproduce:

# In the app, go to a course and download a SCORM package. Don't leave the course contents view.
# In Moodle, update the package and use a ZIP with a different name.
# In the app, enter the SCORM, do a Pull To Refresh and go back to course contents view. Check that you see the refresh icon.
# Click the refresh icon. Check that an error is shown.

This is because the SCORM course content handler calls _getScorm_ when it's loaded, not when the download button is clicked. This causes that the URL used when the refresh button is clicked is the old one, so the download fails because the package isn't found. If you leave the view and load it again everything works fine.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: SCORM: Error downloading SCORM if package is updated and course contents view is cached

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: albert.gasset
description:
The dialog with the message "You need to log in to the site in a browser window." is shown twice when a fixed URL is set in config.json, and login is done via a browser window.

Steps to reproduce:
# Set the type of login to "Via a browser window" in the local plugin settings
# Build a custom app with a fixed URL in www/config.json (parameter "siteurl").
# Install and launch the app in a device.
# The dialog with text "You need to log in to the site in a browser window." is shown. Click "OK" and enter the username / password in the browser.

Result:
The same dialog is showm again, although you can see the "My courses" page is loaded in the background (see the attached screenshot). If you click "Cancel" you can continue to use the app as normal, already logged in. If you click "OK" the browser window is launched again.

This happens on Android, I have not tested other platforms.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: albert.gasset
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Users asked to login twice using a browser window on custom apps

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Now that the capture normal and activity links features is done, we should allow to open specific pages in the app via Custom URL Scheme, something like:

moodlemobile://link=https://mysite.es/mod/choice/view.php?id=8

should open the Choice with Cmid = 8 in the https://mysite.es site

Please, note that is the same site is available for more than one user in the app, the user should select the profile he wants to use.
If the app was previously open in one of those sites, we can skip the profile selection step and go directly to the module.

If the site does not exit, we must ask the user to enter his username and password (the site must be preloaded) and then redirect to the activity

For the record, we'll also support URLs with username prefix, like: moodlemobile://link=https://username@mysite.es/mod/choice/view.php?id=8 this will help us to better identify a site or prefill the username in the authentication form
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Support opening app pages via Custom URL Schemes

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: rjones987
description:
1. Go to an enrolled course in the iOs Moodle App.
2. Go to topic with the file (PDF/MP4/PPT etc)
3. Tap the file name, then "Open the file"
4. A grey screen opens, but instead of showing the file, it displays an alphanumerical filename with no extension, along with filesize. ie "09676eea63d1b58112f702ab996513fc 3.5 MB"

The file can be shared using iOS sharing but it only sends the file with the alphanumeric name and no file extension.  It is possible to append the file extension to the file and it opens correctly.

Different display settings ie "Embed/Open/Force Download" produce same error.
The file uploaded to Moodle has no spaces or non-alpha characters in the name, and has the correct file extension.

iOS v9.2.1
Moodle App v2.8
Moodle 3.0.2+ (Build: 20160121)

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
While testing to release Moodle Mobile 2.8 we found 3 issues related with SCORM:

# Leaving the player doesn't trigger iframe's unload event.
# It can happen that a SCORM tries to be synced while something is being written and that could cause inconsistencies.
# There's an error in the snapshots of new attempts created from an online attempt.
# saveTracksSync doesn't use local_mobile.
# Sometimes the SCORM API calls saveTracksSync without any data in online. This causes the call to fail because it lacks a param, so an offline attempt is created when it shouldn't.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Fix SCORM issues found in 2.8 release testing

creator.name: dpalou
description:
While developing the SCORM addon we thought it would be nice to have a "Notices" feature where you can see some messages that happened (generated in the app). This would be useful for synchronization and background processes, since failure messages and warnings would be added to this section.

This new option should be added to the side menu. We would have to differentiate between read and unread messages, and show a bubble with the number of new messages so the user sees it in the side menu.

creator.name: dpalou
description:
Until now we passed objects as state params sometimes, like in course completion, course sections, grades, etc. After struggling with MOBILE-1361 I think we need to avoid it if possible because it causes problems:

# Ionic/Angular is unable to detect we're going to a new state if an object's property changes (it doesn't perform a deep compare).
# When comparing current state stack with new state stack in _$state.transitionTo_ it happened to me that two param objects had the same properties but they were different instances, so they were detected as different params and a state was reloaded when it shouldn't.
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Don't pass objects as state params

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
The app should follow enrolment links like:

/enrol/index.php?id=8288

The user must be automatically enrolled and redirected to the course contents if all the following conditions are met:
- The user is not enrolled in the course
- The course has a self-enrolment plugin method enabled
- There is only one instance of a self-enrolment plugin
- The self-enrolment unique instance is not configured to require a password

Once the user is enrolled, the courses cache should be empty 

If the user can't be enrolled we'll display a message and a link to the web site
If a password is required, we'll require the password to the user

creator.name: jleyva
description:
Right now I think that we only should update the remote zip package if the sha1 change.
For remote zip packages the sha1 change only if the teacher/admin updates the resource and point to a different URL.

The reason to not update the package using the frequency indicated in the module settings is that there is a bug MDL-52459 open that prevent the remote package to be updated. In this scenario, if we update the package the zip package in the app and the imsmanifest.xml has changed, we will be displaying an invalid TOC (because we read the TOC from the site where probably is the old package and not from the package).

In any case, we need to keep this issue open until MDL-52459 is solved to make a final decission.
issuetype.name: Sub-task
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Open
status.statusCategory.name: To Do
summary: Downloaded packages (remote zip packages) are not auto-updated

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
Every time the SCORM zip package is downloaded we need to pre-fetch some data. This is because we need this data to set-up the TOC and run-time API for the user.
So basically what we need is:
- First, call to get_scorm_attempt_count to obtain the last attempt (completed or not)
- Call to get_scorm_user_data to obtain all the data for the attempt
- Call get_scorm_scoes to obtain all the SCOes for all the organizations (one call for obtaining all the orgs and then one call per-organization)
- Call get_scorm_sco_tracks for each SCO in all organizations (attempt = 0 - last attempt)
issuetype.name: Sub-task
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Pre-fetch Web Services requests when the SCORM package is going to be downloaded

description:
When you add a new file in a folder in Moodle, it updates the revision number of all the folder files. This means that the app detects them as outdated, showing a refresh button and re-downloading them all if the user clicks to prefetch the whole folder.

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
We usually calculate the revision and timemodified of a module using its list of files. In content handlers we use the full list of files (module.contents), that's the right way. In $mmFilepool#_downloadOrPrefetchPackage we don't have the full list, the list of files we're supplying has been filtered to remove the not downloadable files, so the calculation of revision and timemodified can be wrong.

Also, until now we've always used the FIRST file to calculate the revision and timemodified, maybe we should iterate over all the files and get the highest one.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Timemodified calculation is wrong in the new _downloadOrPrefetchPackage

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
The function _$mmCoursesDelegate#updateNavHandlersForCourse_ is called twice per course when the user logins or starts the app: once for login event, and once when the site data is updated. This function empties the course handlers array and fills it again with the enabled addons.

In some addons, the call _isEnabledForCourse_ is asynchronous (grades, course completion), and sometimes the following case happens:

# Login event, _updateNavHandlers_ starts. Empty _courseHandlers_.
# Synchronous addons are added to the list, asynchronous ones are waiting for a response.
# The site data is updated, so _updateNavHandlers_ starts again. _courseHandlers_ is emptied now.
# Synchronous addons are added to the list, asynchronous ones are waiting for a response.
# The first call of asynchronous addons ends, so they're added to _courseHandlers_.
# The second call of asynchronous addons ends, so they're added to _courseHandlers_ again.

With some changes in code this can be reproduced 100% of times:

# Modify $mmaGrades#isPluginEnabledForCourse and add a timeout in there to make it slower. I used a 1 second timeout.
# Modify $mmCoursesDelegate#updateNavHandler and add a timeout too. I used 1 second too.

With these 2 changes I always see the grades plugin 2-3 times.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Some course addons are shown twice sometimes

Browsing buttons (similar to the IMSCP one) should be displayed from moving between SCOes) (just to go back and forward, please, notice that since SCORMS can have multiple node levels the forward button means to go to the next node no matter what the level is, for example, for N1, N2, N2.1, N2.3., N3, if we are in N2 the next button will go to N2.1

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
A new option for downloading all the course contents will be added in the course content section.
This option will download sequentially all the resources and activities that require file downloading (like SCORM) in the app using a download process.

All the resources downloaded via this process will be available offline. For resources that are currently downloaded this option will force the download again only if the resource was updated in the server.

Download process differences between Android and iOs:
In iOs (iPhone, iPad) if the app goes to background the downloads are frozen. (This is something that we can’t control, is done automatically by the operating system)
In Android, even if the app is in background the download continues.

Some things to consider:
# Previously to start downloading files, we should calculate the total download size and:
# * If the user is not connected via Wi-Fi and the download size is >= XMB? Display a confirm dialog so the user must confirm the download (indicating the approximate size)
# * If the user is connected via Wi-Fi and te download size is >= YMB? Display a confirm dialog so the user must confirm the download (indicating the approximate size)
# * In both cases, try to retrieve the remaining sdcard space and show warnings in case if it's not enough or very close to the download size

X and Y... what about 10MB for no Wi-Fi and 100MB for Wi-Fi?

Maybe we should display a download progress with %?
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: New download all option (for downloading all the course contents)

creator.name: dpalou
description:
An interesting feature would be to have a queue of WS requests that failed because the device was offline or we couldn't connect to the server. This would allow the user to perform in offline things like sending messages, adding posts to forums or play a SCORM.

If the calls failed because the device was offline we could re-try them when the device goes online, but what happens if the requests failed because the server was down or something? Maybe we should re-try them every certain time as long as the device is connected.

Also, Juan suggests that the user should be able to see the queue, force a re-try and also delete some requests from the queue.

In the case of messages it would be nice if they could be seen in the conversation as long as they're in the queue, and allow the user deleting them from there like it happens with WhatsApp.
issuetype.name: Epic
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Offline improvements in the Mobile app

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: bassamkr
description:
Hi
Can anyone help me please,
I am using moodle 2.5 and i have tried to activate moodle mobile, but when i run the mobile application i get the error "Moodle Mobile Additional features check returned an unexpected response, you will be authenticated using the standard Mobile service" ... 
As per Moodle documentation to enable Moodle Mobile Application, we tried all the following cases and it was not working:
1-	In Administration > Site administration > Plugins > Web services > Mobile tick the 'Enable web services for mobile devices' checkbox, then click the button to save changes.
Source: https://docs.moodle.org/25/en/Mobile_app;

2-	Using Moodle Mobile additional features (plugin) without “Mobile app Push Notifications”:
•	Unpack the zip file into the local/ directory. A new directory will be created called local/mobile. 
•	Go to Site administration > Notifications to complete the plugin installation. 
•	Go to Site administration > Plugins > Web services > Mobile, enable "Enable web services for mobile devices" (Remember to save the changes) 
•	Go to Site administration > Plugins > Web services > External services, edit "Moodle Mobile additional features" and check the "Enabled" field, then save changes. 
•	Go to Site administration > Users >Permissions Define roles, edit the Authenticated user role and allow the capability moodle/webservice:createtoken. 
•	Note: You need to have upgraded the Moodle Mobile app to version 1.4.4. 
If you are currently using the Moodle Mobile app, you will need to log out of all your sites in order for the app to detect the new service
Source: https://docs.moodle.org/25/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features;

3-	Using Moodle Mobile additional features (plugin) with “Mobile app Push Notifications”:
Similar to second case, in addition I installed “Mobile app Push Notifications” but in its configuration, by clicking " Request access key”  I got ("An error occurred while retrieving key. Your Moodle site must be registered with Moodle.org to use this service. You may need to re-register to update your details there."). Note: The system is already registered to Moodle.org, in addition I reregistered it and message still appears.
Source: https://docs.moodle.org/25/en/Mobile_app_Push_Notifications;
Source: https://docs.moodle.org/25/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features;

Thank you.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: bassamkr
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Moodle mobile installation

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
The authentication process is the following:

# Check if site exists. We see if we need to use http or https in here.
# Check if the app should use local_mobile.
# (User inputs credentials).
# Try to get user token. If this call returns 'requirecorrectaccess', we add 'www' to the URL and try again.

The problem is that the local_mobile check also returns 'requirecorrectaccess' if we should use 'www', so the user won't use local_mobile unless he manually inputs those 'www'.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Apply 'www' to local_mobile check if the call returns 'requirecorrectaccess'

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: dpalou
description:
Example: I have a site with wwwroot = 192.168.1.10/mymoodle. I add that site in the app, so it's stored with that URL. Then I change that value to localhost/mymoodle. The requests performed from the app from now on will have this answer: {noformat} Redirect
Incorrect access detected, this server may be accessed only through "http://192.168.1.48/moodlemaster" address, sorry.
Please notify server administrator.
Redirect
This page should automatically redirect. If nothing is happening please use the continue link below.
Continue
{noformat} $mmWS doesn't detect this as an error, so this string is passed as the success of the call, causing some errors in the app. E.g. in _$mmaCalendar#getEvents_ we perform courses.push with that response, so we get an exception because it's not an array. I also got an error like "Cannot read property length of undefined" when I restarted the app. The service performing the request needs to check if the returned data is valid, but maybe it'd be useful to detect this type of error in $mmWS if it's feasible.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dpalou
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Invalid wwwroot in config.php can cause errors in sites already stored

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: fred
description:
While discussing with [~barbararamiro] about the development of the glossary we realised that the description could be a real usability issue when it is long. It would push the content down so much that it makes it a hindrance more than it would help. A good example to this can be seen browsing the forums of Moodle.org from the app.

As we should keep the description but give more emphasis on the content, Barbara thought it would be a good idea to apply the same logic we have for labels: Shorten the text to about two lines following by an ellipsis, tapping the description will lead to a new state that displays the description in full.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: fred
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: When a module's description is long it can push the content down too much

creator.name: krause
description:
Hi Juan,
the Moodle Mobile app for iOS updated today up to 2.3. The iPad works with iOS 9.0.2.

I tried to login a Moodle website with Moodle 2.9.1 and the plugin local_mobile installed. The mobile web service is allowed and everything should be okay. A normal user can't login. He gets a message that he has no permission to create a web service token.

I logged in with a browser using an admin account to look for the tokens. No token. I added a token manually for the user and I get a list of missing permissions. Please look at the screenshot. After this the user is able to login. I think that the creation of the webservice tokens should work automatically.

Best wishes, Ralf

We are going to remove that WS because it's not currently used, we should rely in the information returned by get_site_info to check the Moodle version (version and release).

Notice that it's possible that sometimes the release or versions values may be empty (not sure if it's a bug in older versions)

assignee.name: jleyva

description:
Reported via the forum:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=321361

I suspect that the problem is in:
 $cordovaNetwork - The function that check if the device is online consider NETWORK_UNKNOWN as offline
 Cordova library - NETWORK_UNKNOWN is returned in some cases (when a valid Wifi is being used)

We should create custom .apks and ask people affected to check

priority.name: Critical
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Network checks are failing in some devices and wifis

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jleyva
description:
This has been reported a couple of times (for example https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=321605), we perform a HEAD request to check if a site exists/is valid but sometimes depending on the server configuration (or proxies or firewalls), these types of requests are forbidden and we get 403 errors.

In order to fix that, we can safely replace the HEAD request with a GET one
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Replace the HEAD request in $mmSitesManager#siteExists with a GET request

assignee.name: dpalou
creator.name: jleyva
description:
We should allow users to search courses because:
# Currently, there is no way to browse the course site list
# Admins cannot find courses that they should be able to see in the app
# Normal users cannot find courses they'd be able to self-enrol

We should find a good place to add the new "Search option" considering that we currently have a "filter courses" option in the Courses section.

Once the user is presented with the list of courses matching his search, the user should be able to click in a course name and:
# If the course have the self-enrolment option enabled, there will be a button to process the self-enrolment
# If the current user can see the course contents (we should do a WS call in this case) that means that the user is probably admin so all the normal course options should be presented (Participants, grades, etc...) We can use the core_course_get_courses WS in that case for fetching the course complete information and configuration (for example, completion enabled)
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
