assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jleyva
description:
node-webkit is an app runtime based on Chromium and node.js. You can write native apps in HTML and Javascript with node-webkit. It also lets you to call Node.js modules directly from DOM and enables a new way of writing native applications with all Web technologies.

- Apps written in modern HTML5, CSS3, JS and WebGL.
- Complete support for Node.js APIs and all its third party modules.
- Good performance: Node and WebKit runs in the same thread: Function calls are made straightforward; objects are in the same heap and can just reference each other;
- Easy to package and distribute apps.
- Available on Linux, Mac OSX and Windows

Node Webkit has some incompatibilities problems with Requirejs, we must fix these problems using small hacks and also create a package.json file describing the app to allow anyone to run the app in a Desktop computer using Node Webkit
issuetype.name: Task
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jleyva
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Support Node Webkit for running the Mobile app in Windows, Linux and Mac

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: tonyblundell
description:
As discussed, we'd like to add unit-tests to the scripts in Moodle Mobile's lib directory, and suggest using [Jasmine](http://evanhahn.com/how-do-i-jasmine) as a test-runner.

For the majority of the scripts we would add simple input/output tests.

For the more complex functionality in mm.js, we would like to slightly re-factor the code to make testing easier. The proposed alterations are detailed below.

We'd be delighted to here any thoughts or suggestions.

h1. Function: init

h3. Split into smaller functions:

*   setTouchHandlers
*   setDeviceType
*   setDeviceOS
*   setInComputerState
*   loadCordova
*   loadBackboneRouter
*   setUpAjaxErrorHandling
*   loadModels
*   loadSettings

h3. Add unit tests

*   Test that each function is called.
*   Test that each function sets properties correctly.
*   Test that MM.config is set.

h1. Function: deviceConnected

Mock network states and test connection is reported correctly in each case.

h1. Function: loadLayout

h3. Split into smaller functions:

*   orientationChangeHandler
    Mock various heights and widths, test calculations.

*   mediaQueryChangeHandler
    Mock various MQs, test that the page is reloaded accordingly.

*   setUpTabletModeLayout, setUpPhoneModeLayout
    Mock MQs, test correct function is called.

*   setUpOverflowScrolling, setUpNativeScrolling, setUpJavascriptScrolling
    Mock device types, test correct function is called.

h3. Add unit tests

*   Test that backbone history is started
*   Test that event handlers have been added
*   Test that page is displayed
*   Test that MM.loadExtraJs is called

h1. Function: loadSite

h3. Split into smaller functions

*   setUpConfig
    Test that setConfig is called for current_site and current_token.

*   setUpLanguages
    Test that MM.lang.setup is called for each plugin.

*   loadCachedRemoteCSS
    Mock cache element, test that CSS URL is set accordingly.

*   loadCourses
    Split further based on comments. Mock WS. Test that each function is called.
  
h3. Add unit tests

*   Test that MM.sync.init is called
*   Test that MM.sync.css is called
*   Test that MM.lang.sync is called
*   Mock device type, test that tablet panels are shown or hidden accordingly.

h1. Function: addSite

Mock input, test that MM.saveSite is called if input is valid and vice versa.

h1. Function: saveSite

* Split out nested function to improve readability.
* Mock WS calls, test handling of success and failure.

h1. Function: registerPlugin

*   Test that the plugin is added to this.plugins.
*   Test that the plugin's routes are added to the router.
*   Test that loadModels is called.
*   Test that MM.lang.loadPluginLang is called.
*   Test that MM.sync.registerHook is called (based on mocked plugin.sync attr).

h1. Function: loadModels

*   Test that this.models and this.collections are set based on mocked args. 
*   Test that bbproperties is set based on mocked args.

h1. Function: moodleWSCall

h3. Split into smaller functions

*   addOperationToQueue
    Test that this is called when device is offline.

*   getDataFromCache
    Test that this is called if preSets.cache is set.

*   Inline function definitions for AJAX success and failure
    Mock AJAX call, test functions accordingly.

h1. Function: moodleUploadFile 

*   Split out device not connected code. Test that this is called appropriately.
*   Test that ft.upload is called.
*   Split out success and failure functions. Mock ft.upload. Test calls. 

h1. Function: moodleDownloadFile

Mock ft.download. Test the success and error calls.

h1. Function: wsSync

*   Split out WS call, upload and download code and unit test each individually.
*   Mock device connected state and test that function exits when not connected. 

h1. Function: displaySettings

Test that settings panel is shown and includes all plugins.

h1. Function: getConfig

Add simple output tests.

h1. Function: setConfig

Test MM.db.insert is called with appropriate arguments.

h1. Function fixPluginFile

Add simple output tests.

h1. Function: log

Test that console.log is called and contains the passed message.

h1. Function: getFormattedLog

Mock MM.logData. Test that each entry is returned and passed to console.log.

h1. Function: showLog

*   Test that MM.getFormattedLog is called.
*   Test that the panel is shown containing the log data and filter anchor.
*   Test that that the event handler is added to the filter anchor click. 
*   Mock the filter anchor click and test that MM.showLog is called.

h1. Function: popErrorMessage

*   Test that routing is reset.
*   Test that popMessage is called with the passed message.

h1. Function: popMessage

Test that MM.widgets.dialog is called with the passed message.

h1. Function: popConfirm

Test that MM.popMessage is called with the appropriate options.

h1. Functions: handleExternalLinks and handleFiles

*   Split out the href replacement code. Test that it is called.
*   Split out the event handler and that it is attached.
*   Add unit tests to the handler for the various success and error states.

h1. Function: loadExtraJs

*   Test that the function exits if the device is not connected.
*   Test that each extra JS specified in the config is loaded.

h1. Function: getOS

Mock the device. Test that the device platform is returned in lowercase.

h1. Function: showModalLoading 

Test that MM.widgets.dialog is called with the passed title and text.

h1. Function: closeModalLoading

Test that MM.widgets.dialogClose is called.

h1. Function: refresh

Test that the cache is purged and the site is reloaded.
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: tonyblundell
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Unit-tests

description:
The app completely ignores images in labels - currently they don't show at all, presumably to save how much the app downloads.
But sometimes we put images in a label to make the pages more attractive, sometimes banners and clipart/photos but sometimes ones which are actually links to pages/sites.

Could the app detect if a user is on wifi, and if they are THEN show images?

If images have an alt tag (as moodle warns you to do when inserting images using TinyMCE) could that be displayed in square brackets when not on wifi, so you know an image is there?

And even if this idea is rejected, could you at least detect if images are enclosed by an <a> tag so that a text link to the website appears.

assignee.name: dongsheng
creator.name: jerome
description:
Need a new @route("/accesskeys/").

What we want to achieve:
* a site should be able to broadcast and send individual message. It should be able to broadcast only to the register token to itself (so Airnotifier needs to know which token is linked to which site). So each site should have a personal access key => Airnotifier admin can disable a site. This is only useful if:
** a site can not request multiple access keys
** we can clearly confirm that it's the right site (like the registration confirmation process)
* a device should be able to create a token and mention which site can access to it.
issuetype.name: Sub-task
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Airnotifer: site broadcast support (accesskey API)

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
After using a bit more the app on iOS with the childbrowser, I changed my mind. 

On iOS when we click on the world icon it opens a childbrowser. I think it makes sens to open the Moodle site into the childbrowser when clicking on the non-downloadable content rows too. It provides a very quick access to any file content and it can not break the app (because the childbrowser is a different browser).

On Android, when we click on the world icon it opens an external browser. It can be pretty slow to open an external browser. It's specially annoying because the site is opened in a new tab all the time. As we didn't support custom plugin previously, I suggested to not encourage the access to the external browser, so we removed the direct row click. 

I suggest both system behave this way now:
* each non-downloadable content row opens the childbrowser => no grey row + no need world icon anymore.
* display a bottom bar that let you quickly go back to the app without breaking anything. I saw they patched the childbrowser on android to support it.

What do you think?
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Non-downloadable content row directly opens the site with one touch

assignee.name: jleyva

description:
We need a automatic build based on the step there:
http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_Building_the_app_for_Android#Build_the_official_Moodle_Mobile_app_on_a_Mac

1) write a small build script (do not deal with initial install stuff, it's really just a script to re-build)
2) need a server to install android sdk + build script (access to Jerome and Juan)
3) install android sdk and other stuff required by the build script
4) run the script by cron
5) web server or nodejs server or whatever is the quickest to for us install. The goal is to download apk file, nothing more.

Think simple (we are not redoing a phonegap build :))

assignee.name: jleyva

description:
When you press the back button, the topic list stays at the same position and is displayed till the animation end. 

I think two solutions:
a) make the content follow the animation (obviously it's the expected result but may be difficult to implement)
b) hide the content as soon you press the back button, before triggering the animation. It's quick fix till we tackle back a) but it should improve the glitch greatly I imagine. You also can play with the way you hide it. For example try to see if fading the content help to make the all thing pleasant for the eyes. Fading is the way JQM went for most of their default animations.

PS: Note that the "select arrow topic icon" does follow the slide animation. (maybe it is a background image it would explain it behave differently from div, I didn't check it...)

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
I just tested the app on Android 2.3 - HTC desire.

The scrolling performance are so bad than the app is not usable. Many 2.3 devices will generate deserved 1 star review.

However I tested the Sencha Touch Kitchen Sink web app on the stock browser of this device and the scrolling is very nice even on a long list of item with the same image in each rows.

We can not release on this "old" devices like that.

Solutions:
* fix the scrolling on 2.3 to be as good as Sencha Touch. 
* make an old device version. Remove icons, images, and everything that are not 100% the core goal feature like the overlay info...
* we don't release the app on 2.3
issuetype.name: Improvement

reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved

summary: Scrolling performance need serious improvement on 2.3 devices

description:
If you don't specify the protocol when adding a site, you are given an inappropriate error message. A 'Site URL' has been specified, but you don't like it ;)
Ideally though we should do what the user wants and:
* try https:// ; and failing that
* try http://

Alternatively, make http:// and https:// a dropdown list immediately before the text box to allow the user to select one or other.

description:
When you click on a course content or participants it takes a while to display because a web service call is executed. However the user doesn't know why and think the app is slow, sometimes not working and try to touch other things.

Add a loading icon to right of the row when the behavior happens. It doesn't matter if it's super fast, so if it makes your life easier, you can display the loading even thought you already did the call so you're getting the data from the localstorage.

Obvious places:
* content menu option rows
* participant menu option rows
* topic rows
* participant rows

Note that if a icon is already on the right, you can temporarily replace it during the loading.

assignee.name: jmgifreu
creator.name: jerome
description:
During last meeting we mentioned that we should change the Upload icon using a Moodle icon. 

The closest one I could find was the export.svg. I'm unsure about that:

* I think it's good to use Moodle icons.
* but I don't like the idea to use a Moodle icon for the purpose to use a Moodle icon, specially if the feature behavior differs, it would be only confusing. Barbara also mentioned Portfolioadd.png that could match the feature too, making me think we are going in the wrong direction trying to absolutely get Moodle icons in the app.

* I think it's ok to use the export icon because if you do a search on google image you can see it's more used for Upload than our current cloud icon. I think it's quite a essential good point.
* but I think it's not great in the sens this icon would be more appropriate for exporting to Dropbox/VLC/... apps than uploading in Moodle.

At the end I would suggest to switch for export.svg because it's more understandable than a cloud image (Moodle site is not considered as Cloud by people) and we still can use standard share icon for export to Dropbox and co. Please, give your opinion ;)
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Change current Upload "cloud" icon for a 'Moodle pix folder" icon

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
Tested with build.phonegap today version

Connect on cva site, course Film short sort, Contents. Look at the content page

Android:
Portrait - Nexus - 4.2: the content page is fully scrollable and finish by "Topic1" to "Topic8" grey bar. The last tiny grey bar is half displayed.

iOS:
Landscape - iPad 2: fully scrollable. The content page ends by the entire "Open chat" option. No "Topic1" to "Topic8" bars are displayed.
Portrait - iPad2/3: not scrollable but all option are displayed on the screen. However the last option "Open chat" is half displayed. 

From these tests:

assignee.name: jleyva

description:
This is most likely going to be separate in multiple issues, here is a list of things we saw when reviewing the app with Barbara (so we remember to check them later):
* can not close the info overlay easily. If you click on it or somewhere else it doesnt close
* the download arrow and info icon are not vertically centered
* the download arrow and info icon are very small and it's very hard to press on them on tablet (iPad 2 / kindle fire)
* the course icon in the main menu are not the correct, they should be the new Moodle circle icon: pix/i/course.svg. Overall Barbara tell me that all menu icon should be taken from pix/i/*.svg when possible.
* In Settings > Synchronization > Task queue: the word empty is a bit weird. Maybe when it's empyt it should be a normal row saying "no tasks to synchronized"
* Personal preference: I'm not fan of the button design. They are too light, they don't feel like button. They are not that easy to touch (too small vertically). Often they got multiple lines... overall I don't feel them right. (Jerome)
* few missing profile field in participant profile that trigger different action: telephone, googlemap... Note that it may be implemented, it needs to be tested with own site the demo site doesn't seeem to have them.
* Barbara and I we prefer the simple/common menu icon a la facebook than the Moodle M in the top orange bar. See sheet 54 on "Moodle app studies" googledocs.
* there are few css glitches compare to Barbara design (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1feYdg8bXy8Lo5BXfBiwollDTcpP4rvncUffWL_D4EgA/edit): top orange bar color/background not matching orange menu color/background - top orange bar doesn't fully fit the screen (white space on the very right on iPad2) - In the menu, the "settings" dark option without text should be the same height than the "My courses" dark option.

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
This issue should be cloned anytime we are going to release a new version pointing to the new version in the  Fix Version/s field.

Task to be performed every time we are going to release a new version:

- Bump version numbers (config.json and config.xml) Config.xml includes the iOs Bundle name
- Disable debugging in config.json
- Update (bump versions) of the local_mobile plugin for all version if it has changes or new features
- Update the local_moodlemobileapp plugin with new strings in moodle.org/plugins
- Update language strings and pack from AMOS
- QA tests
- Create a TAG in github with the version number
- Build the app for Android
- Build the app for iPhone
- Release the app in Play Store
- Release the app in Apple app Store
- Update release notes (http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_Release_Notes)
- Update Developers Documentation
- Update User Documentation
- Forum and twitter announcements
issuetype.name: Task
priority.name: Critical
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Release new version

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
For example in the course content screen I clicked on the Forum, the phone tried to load web browser page with the site offering me a login screen.
There is few issues in this process:
a) overall, in all app, it's slow to open a browser but also slow to go back (and I use a Galaxy Nexus) - it's not pleasant
b) I didn't know what was going to happen, it kind of quit the app. I felt frustrated to not be alerted.
c) when I pressed back button, I had a blank page and could not do anything more. I had to close the app. note I tried again and the back button did work but once I pressed it another time then it got stuck into the course content screen. In fact I believe it did go on the previous screen but the current page got display on top. If I pressed back twice more the button, then I quit the app which make think it's the issue with the screen content being kept all over the screens.

I think we could:
a) display an alert saying you are going to be redirected to the site.
a-2) display the menu bar on top so we still have the M icon to go back to the menu without using the bad "Back button" of android phone -> not that we would be stuck in the case of iOS.
b) doing nothing, just greying all activity without app viewer.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Do not open straight the site when clicking on a not implemented course content viewer - user stuck on the site if no OS back button

description:
Often in the previous app when an authentication error happens (for multiple reason) a generic error message were displayed. If it's still the case, then the app could offer a button Help when displaying the warning. This Help button would open a Moodledocs page that explain what are the steps to do to resolve the issue. This Moodledocs page must be exhaustive and must completed everytime we find a new cause of failure.

Also check that that if the error message is generic, it should explicit enough. More "The Moodle site is not reachable or it's version is lower than 2.1" than "Moodle version must be 2.1 or greater"

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jerome
description:
I think to keep many contributions it's important to keep the code as free as possible. GPL seems a bit restrictive causing two issues:
- released apps on the app store must give their source code. If I understood GPL: an app (software) != web site (service). Some university/company won't reveal their additional source code.
- GPL seems to clash with the app store: http://www.zdnet.com/blog/open-source/no-gpl-apps-for-apples-app-store/8046

I think something like MIT license seems good to me (http://jordanopensource.org/freeplanet/article/open-source-license-used-widely-app-store-apps)
issuetype.name: Task
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: License choice for moodlemobile

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: jleyva
description:
It's not obvious to choose the persistent storage system for mobile apps.

Phonegap provide two ways:
http://docs.phonegap.com/en/1.9.0/cordova_storage_storage.md.html#Storage

local storage (dom storage) http://dev.w3.org/html5/webstorage/
local SQL database http://dev.w3.org/html5/webdatabase/

The main problem here is that the SQL database spec is deprecated and not maintained, also is only available for Android and iPhone

assignee.name: moodle.com
creator.name: udhaya
description:
We developed a native interface for smartphone based on Android v. 2.2 and v. 2.3 version.
It implements some basics functions of a Moodle platform for the student role:
0) login (normal login account)
1) read the list of your course
2) see your calendar
3) see your grades
4) see the resources (PDF, doc, xls, ppt, txt)
5) read the forums and reply to a post
6) see the list of participants
It relies on the package of OKTech webservice (http://docs.moodle.org/20/en/Web_Services:OK_Tech_Web_Services#Installation).

If useful, we could share it (it is a joint project of eLab - USI and SUPSI http://www.elearninglab.org/ and Faculty of Informatics at USI http://www.inf.usi.ch/), let us know.
Best regards,
Luca (luca.mazzola_AT_usi.ch)
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: udhaya
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: CLONE - native client for Android-based smartphone for Moodle

assignee.name: jerome
creator.name: andreabix
description:
When using Moodle app for iPhone, app does not refresh courses when user are enrolled in a new course after first app connection.

To reproduce:
- as admin or manager, on a Moodle 2.2 site, enroll "user A" in "course X"
- as "user A", connect to the site using official Moodle iPhone App
- check if "user A" is able to see "course  X" from the official Moodle iPhone app using the "contents" button
- as admin or manager, now enroll "user A" in "course Y" on the same site
- as "user A", access the iPhone app and check available courses in "contents" button. New course is not displayed.

Moodle version: Moodle 2.2+ (Build: 20111209)
App version: latest available from App store installed on December, 22th, 2011.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Major
reporter.name: andreabix
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: New course enrollment not refreshed

assignee.name: jerome
creator.name: jerome
description:
Version 1.0.2

a) Add a site (qa.moodle.net teacher), browse quickly around the app.
b) Add a site (qa.moodle.net manager) and stay on this site

- in meanwhile I turned off network and queue a note with option sync turned off. however I don't think it's related at all, so you don't need to do it -

c) let the My Moodle process running on the main page

Version 1.1

c) upgrade the app
d) launch the app (in fact it's already running). You don't see the Contents feature, which is quite normal. I don't think we really need to care too much about that, it's just not refresh.
e) go to the sync page, come back to the dashboard. The Contents feature is now here.
f) go to select Site and select the other site account (qa.moodle.net teacher)
g) the Content feature never appears, the user need to update the site to see it. We probably just update the current site during the migration, or maybe there is an new with multiple account for the same site.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: jerome
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Contents doesn't get display for second site except if force Site upload

assignee.name: dongsheng
creator.name: smj276
description:
We have an issue where uploaded items from the moodle iphone app are unable to be opened.

please see my communications with our ICT support.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++=

Hi ****

we continue to get 404 message in moodle 2. when clicking on a file uploaded into  my private files from the moodle iphone app. can you please investigate?

REPLY

I think we've already solved this one. It's a bug with Moodle that doesn't like "+" symbols in file names otherwise it will return you a 404 not found error.
This is why it happens with all platforms (IE, Chrome and the Apple app)

Please re-test when you get a chance of uploading a file without the plus symbol in the filename and if you still have errors, just log another service desk call and I'll investigate. I've already tested this issue with and without the plus symbol and without appears to work fine.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

If i rename the the file and remove the  + then all works fine.
Please see attachment for more info.
issuetype.name: Bug
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: smj276
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: uploaded files causing 404 error

description:
avoiding use + % in filename

From Gregor McNish http://moodle.org/user/view.php?id=479174&course=5

{quote}
've just started looking at the app. A small issue with uploading -- the file uploada fine, but the filename is set to something like "2011-09-12%20012112%20%2B0000.jpg", and the + character seems to cause issues when actually using the file within moodle.

If I change the filename to remove the +  when embedding the image it works fine.

We're using IIS on windows server to serve moodle.

There's a useful blog post here http://blogs.iis.net/robert_mcmurray/archive/2011/04/27/bad-characters-to-use-in-web-based-filenames.aspx

which references RFC1296 which includes + (among others) as a reserved character in URLs.
{quote}
issuetype.name: Improvement
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: dongsheng
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: Tweak files' names being uploaded to moodle

assignee.name: jleyva
creator.name: nebgor
description:
currently the iphone app doesn't attempt to send data at all when there is no data connection or the iphone is in airplane mode. (There is a setting to do this)
This setting seems to be a hack to prevent attempts to send data when there is no connections. This shouldn't be a setting, it just shouldn't send data when there is no connection. It should queue it.

A setting to set preferences of channels over which to send data would be great. This would allow students/teachers to avoid abusing their expensive connections and send everything when on the school wifi or preferred wifi. It could get more preferences , but for now choosing between 3G and wifi would be very practical imho.

for example:
 Data connections:
  * [on/off] send data over 3G or via mobile broadband service.
  * [on/off] send data over wifi connection.

with this we can explicitly control what the app senses as a valid data connection to send data through.
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: nebgor
status.name: Resolved
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: enable and disable sending data over 3g and over wifi separately.

description:
- Go to take a picture, take a picture, press Use button. A ultra quick alter box appears (don't have time to see what's on), then you are redirected to the main upload page.
- Go to browse Photo album, select a picture: Preview view doesn't display the preview picture but it's a black screen
- Twice during my testing I could browse my iPhone dashboard from the Preview view => obviously a iOS bug, can't do much.
- I once sent an image (from the black preview screen), when I came back to the upload screen the app froze.
- the first time I press browse Photo album: it takes 5 seconds for the phone to display the Photo Albums.
- 3G phone can not create folders with the current code. Need to check if there is an alternative.

3G phone has a lot less memory than other devices. Need to check if we can:
a) know how memory is left for the app
b) know how memory we need
c) free some memory

At worst we could abandon upload functionalities on 3G. We already abdandoned the Audio upload. It's a bit the Apple way to solve the issue with iPhone 3G related issues. Note that Apple gave up with iOS update on iPhone 3G (even security issues).

assignee.name: moodle.com
creator.name: mazzolal
description:
We developed a native interface for smartphone based on Android v. 2.2 and v. 2.3 version.
It implements some basics functions of a Moodle platform for the student role:
0) login (normal login account)
1) read the list of your course
2) see your calendar
3) see your grades
4) see the resources (PDF, doc, xls, ppt, txt)
5) read the forums and reply to a post
6) see the list of participants
It relies on the package of OKTech webservice (http://docs.moodle.org/20/en/Web_Services:OK_Tech_Web_Services#Installation).

If useful, we could share it (it is a joint project of eLab - USI and SUPSI http://www.elearninglab.org/ and Faculty of Informatics at USI http://www.inf.usi.ch/), let us know.
Best regards,
Luca (luca.mazzola_AT_usi.ch)
issuetype.name: New Feature
priority.name: Minor
reporter.name: mazzolal
status.name: Closed
status.statusCategory.name: Done
summary: native client for Android-based smartphone for Moodle
